item.title: Demystifying Service Principals - Managed Identities | Azure DevOps Blog
item.description: Hey friends, In this article, I want to clarify one of the more confusing concepts in Azure and more specifically around the Azure Identity objects known as Service Principals and Managed Identities. Before zooming in on these, let’s take a step back and look at the different Azure Identity Objects we have available in Azure Active Directory today.

item.title: Genes Carrying Memes – Lessons Learned
item.description: The prospect of CRISPR-Cas9 germline editing has many wondering how it will be used on humans. Will there be more Chinese experimental babies? Will there be super babies? Yes, obviously. It is inevitable. How will future generations of cultures interact when some can bestow advantages of health, strength, and intelligence directly to their progeny?

item.title: Codus Operandi
item.description: "Luck Surface Area" is a turn of phrase that popped out my mouth during a discussion episode of TechZing a few months back and is something I've been meaning to write about ever since but never got around to actually doing. However, thanks to Lance Jones who referenced the concept in a recent blog post I have finally been spurred into action.

item.title: Episode 10: Exploiting Authenticated Encryption Key Commitment!
item.description: Ange Albertini and Stefan Kölbl discuss how new research from Google, the University of Haifa and Amazon is exploiting authenticated encryption to make a PDF decrypt into... a different PDF. And much more.

item.title: Why Robinhood Disabled Buys but not Sells
item.description: There's been enough time for the dust to settle and for Robinhood's actual reason for halting trades to come out. But the question of why only buys and not sells has not really been answered in detail, and that's mainly because it's a pain-in-the-ass and delves deep into how the deposit requirements are calculated by the DTCC for brokers.

item.title: Element suspended on Google Play Store: now resolved.
item.description: Hi all, At 2021-01-29 at 21:35 UTC Google suspended Element from the Play Store without warning or notification.  We submitted an appeal asking for clarification at 23:18, and at 05:31 received a generic update from the Google Play Policy team citing that the app has been removed
